name: Food Surplus
description: Local crops thrive, hunters do very well, or livestock numbers are greater than expected. If this event occurs, it immediately ends any ongoing food shortage event.

criticalSuccess.msg: Your bumper crops include wild harvests that allow you to skip the entire Pay Consumption step of the Upkeep phase of your next Kingdom turn. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="food" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d6">Gain 1d6 Food</button>

success.msg: Your excess crops lead to increased supplies. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="consumption" data-mode="lose" data-turn="next" data-multiple="false" data-value="2">Lose 2 Consumption Next Turn</button> and <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="food" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d6">Gain 1d6 Food</button>

failure.msg: The food surplus isn’t as huge as you’d expected. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="consumption" data-mode="lose" data-turn="next" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Consumption Next Turn</button>

criticalFailure.msg:
What you thought was an excess of food is infested with spoilage, ergot, or other contamination. @gain1Unrest and increase a Ruin of your choice by 1
  • @gain1Corruption
  • @gain1Crime
  • @gain1Decay
  • @gain1Strife
